verses.roman:
ity uktvā ratham āruhya
sārathiṁ prāha satvaraḥ
codayāśvān yataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ
tasya me saṁyugaṁ bhavet

synonyms: iti—thus; uktvā—speaking; ratham—on his chariot; āruhya—climbing; sārathim—to his driver; prāha—said; satvaraḥ—quickly; codaya—drive; aśvān—the horses; yataḥ—to where; kṛṣṇaḥ—Kṛṣṇa; tasya—His; me—with me; saṁyugam—fight; bhavet—must be.
translation: Having said this, he had mounted his chariot and told his charioteer, "Drive the horses quickly to where Kṛṣṇa is. He and I must fight.
